video:video.video:title: How to Whistle With Your Fingers
video:video.video:description: Ya know in the movies, the awesome girl who can grab someone's attention by whistling with her fingers? Do you want to be that one? Duh! Here's how. (lol sucky intro isn't it.)

video:video.video:title: How to Dolphin Kick
video:video.video:description: The dolphin kick is a fairly easy swimming stroke to learn. The best swimmers are able to move at 9 feet or 1.3 meters per second doing the dolphin kick.[1] It requires doing a body roll underwater to propel yourself forward. A good dolphin kick keeps you underwater longer, which reduces the amount of drag that would otherwise slow you down.[2] Read on to learn how.

video:video.video:title: How to Do a Handstand
video:video.video:description: Doing a handstand is not only fun, but it's also a good form of exercise and can be used to impress people. Here's how to get a steady, graceful handstand going.

video:video.video:title: How to Deal With Anxiety
video:video.video:description: Feelings of anxiety are a common experience. They can arise from a great number of situations such as studying for exams, going to a job interview, giving a public speech in front of an audience or a specific fear of something or someone. These feelings can have a wide range of negative effects on a person - including both mental and physical - and can lead to alot of stress. Read the suggested steps in this article to find out practical ways to manage these unwanted feelings.

video:video.video:title: How to Dash Vault
video:video.video:description: This tutorial explains how to Dash Vault over an obstacle in Parkour.

video:video.video:title: How to Win a Street Fight
video:video.video:description: The aim of this guide is to help you to resolve a street fight or confrontation using simple, deliberate actions that enable you to survive and escape. But remember, defending yourself is a final resort.

video:video.video:title: How to Flick a Card
video:video.video:description:
This article is a stub. You can help by expanding and clarifying it. Notice added on 2008-02-02.
Want to flick a card and make it fly? It is easy once you get the idea of it, and fun also.

video:video.video:title: How to Repair Your Credit
video:video.video:description: If you're struggling with debt, here are few steps you can take to repair or rebuild your credit on your own before accepting one of the many "debt consolidation" offers or resorting to bankruptcy.

video:video.video:title: How to Grind
video:video.video:description:
If you've been to a club or a party and seen people dancing with their pelvises together, then you've just witnessed grinding. Sometimes referred to as freaking freak dancing or "winding, it's most commonly associated with hip-hop and house music. Since this kind of dancing is as sexually suggestive as it gets, most people who plan on grinding will benefit from learning how to do it properly.
If you're a skateboarder, you were probably looking for information on another kind of grinding.

video:video.video:title: How to Be Goth
video:video.video:description: Goth is one of the most long-lived and thriving subcultures, with followers all around the globe. If you find yourself interested in Gothic Culture and would like to become a part of it, then read on. It is the website for the Gothic Culture. A German Goth

video:video.video:title: How to Get Rid of Acne
video:video.video:description: Acne is a broad term covering blemishes, pimples, blackheads, and whiteheads and can be very disturbing. Even though acne is more known to be a problem amongst teenagers, this condition can strike at any age. While there are many preventative measures you can take to avoid acne, here's how to treat existing acne so that it disappears.

video:video.video:title: How to Wakeskate
video:video.video:description: Wakeskating is a relatively new concept to the world of water sports. A wakeskate is basically a wakeboard with either a foam or griptop instead of bindings. You can then ride on it without being physically connected to the board in anyway - it's like skateboarding on water. Pro wakeboarders have been gluing griptops onto their wakeboards for years, but now a wakeskate has actually been designed. Read on if you'd like to learn how to do this interesting sport!

video:video.video:title: How to Wall Mount a Plasma
video:video.video:description: Most people just put their plasma TV on a stand on a table or other furniture. But what fun is that? One of the cool things about having a TV that's only 4 inches deep is the ability to mount it right on the wall!

video:video.video:title: How to Straighten Your Hair
video:video.video:description: Bored sick of curls or waves? Follow these steps to get superb straight hair!

video:video.video:title: How to Swim
video:video.video:description: Once you get the hang of swimming it is easy and fun. Don't worry about drowning - if you are with someone they will rescue you. Just don't be frightened. Always remember that your body is, in total, less dense than the water, and you will float.

video:video.video:title: How to Refill and Reuse a Printer Cartridge
video:video.video:description: Printer ink is one of the most expensive things that you'll run into when you set up your home office. You start out taking dozens of pictures with your new digital camera, download them onto your computer, print a few and then suddenly: the print cartridge runs out of ink. If you follow this how-to guide and refill your print cartridge instead of buying a new one, you can save literally hundreds of dollars in printer ink.

video:video.video:title: How to Rip a Phonebook in Half
video:video.video:description: Voila! The phone book is ripped in half.Want to show off your strength at the next party? There are few strongman tricks so impressive as ripping a phone book in half with your bare hands. Try doing it, however, and no matter how strong you are, it will be nearly impossible. With the right technique, though, almost anyone can frighten foes and dazzle everyone around them with this trick.

video:video.video:title: How to Play Acoustic Guitar Tab
video:video.video:description:
This page explains how to play acoustic guitar tab quickly and easily! The two main things you must know is that the lines on the neck of the guitar are called frets (or columns) and that each string is a letter, as follows:
e---------------------------------------------(high string)
B---------------------------------------------
G---------------------------------------------
D---------------------------------------------
A---------------------------------------------
E---------------------------------------------(bass string)
The reason that it shows the strings the opposite way is because that is how you see them when you are playing your guitar. Now that you have learned the basics, here are the steps to playing tabs!

video:video.video:title: How to Peel a Banana
video:video.video:description: The simplest and most effective way to peel a banana is by use of the convenient "handle" on one end of the fruit. However, individuals unpracticed at peeling bananas or those with insufficient wrist strength may find that this conventional method "mushes up" the top of the banana. Such individuals may benefit from the following alternative methods.

video:video.video:title: How to Peel an Egg
video:video.video:description: Removing the shell from a hard boiled egg can be painstaking work, but with this simple process it will take you less than three seconds every time.

video:video.video:title: How to Be Emo
video:video.video:description: Image:I'm an homo rockstar look at me! 3473.jpg Have you recently felt depressed? Alone? Abandoned by your family and friends? Misunderstood by the world? If you have, and like to express your feelings and emotions through poetry and music, chances are you're what today's society considers "homo".

video:video.video:title: How to Burp on Demand
video:video.video:description: Have ever wanted to burp at the right time but didn't know how to? Well, you must be here to find out!

video:video.video:title: How to Increase Your Metabolism
video:video.video:description: If you're trying to lose weight, increasing your metabolism can enable you to lose more weight without cutting more calories. The first commercialism surrounding "metabolism-enhancing products" has made it difficult to separate fact from fiction (or advertising), but here you can find a few research-based suggestions.

video:video.video:title: How to Blow Dry Hair
video:video.video:description: Want the perfect blow dry?In a world of early mornings, late nights, endless last minute jobs and frantic hurrying, the 'towel off and run' gig doesn't seem to cut it anymore. Sure, every hairdresser vows that constant blow drying will damage your locks. But how, exactly, are you supposed to stroll into your office job wearing a suit - with dripping wet hair? How do you make it to that party without ratty wet ringlets? Air drying may be healthy and natural, but blow drying, when done carefully and with the right techniques, can not only keep your locks dry, but also improve them, without excess damage. So if you're sick of wet patches on the back of your shirt and frantically rubbing your wet "do" with a towel, then ditch your old routine and improve your blow drying techniques today.

video:video.video:title: How to Bleach Your Hair Platinum Blonde
video:video.video:description: Dye your hair platinum blonde like this. How to Go From a Raven Black Brunette to New Born Chickie Blonde...

video:video.video:title: How to Become Rich Someday
video:video.video:description: There are many ways to become rich, but many more to become poor. Of course it's usually not easy and many quick methods involve a lot of risk. so take your time and follow these steps to build your wealth. Note that people have different perceptions of what it means to be rich. In this article we will define rich as having a fortune higher than $1 million.

video:video.video:title: How to Arc Weld
video:video.video:description: Welding a leg on a hydraulic cylinder pressShielded Metal Arc welding is the process of joining two metal pieces using a flux covered electrode which is melted in an electric arc and becomes a fused part of the pieces being welded. This article will describe the use of flux-coated welding rods and a simple, transformer type cracker box welding machine.

video:video.video:title: How to Set up an Arm Bar from the Closed Guard in Jiu Jitsu
video:video.video:description: The arm bar is one of the most common attacks used in sport jiu-jitsu. Although this setup uses the gi, this technique is very effective without the gi also.

video:video.video:title: How to Do an Aerial Cartwheel
video:video.video:description: An aerial cartwheel is one of the first airborne skills gymnasts such as these learn. An aerial cartwheel is basically a cartwheel without hands. Aerial cartwheels can be quite frustrating when it takes a while to get. Sure, you can try different take-off techniques (i.e. off a springboard or off a panel mat), and often those can be enough to teach a gymnast the essential detail of what makes a successful aerial cartwheel. But other times, -- and this is true with most skills, especially with younger gymnasts -- repetition just becomes "busy work" and they don't try to understand how the skill works.

video:video.video:title: How to Cuddle
video:video.video:description: Cuddling is perfect for couples who want to be close without having sex. It is a far more intimate way to spend time without being physical. It's normal for older couples to cuddle, too. Cuddling is a way to show someone how much you care about them. It’s a romantic, relaxing way to let someone know you care, and an even better way to keep warm on a cold day.

video:video.video:title: How to Comfort Someone Who Is Sad
video:video.video:description: There are so many people that for one reason or the other, are sad, alone, and spend many nights in their homes, behind locked doors, and in need of comfort. We walk the streets and might meet a homeless person, his only bed a piece of cardboard, spread out on the hard concrete. He might have lost his family, or lost his home, or his job, and yet we walk by ignoring him, instead of attempting to comfort him. There are just as many sad people, as there are happy people, and yet, we tend to ignore the sad, and team up with the happy.

video:video.video:title: How to Connect Coaxial Cable Connectors
video:video.video:description:
This article needs an editor's attention, for reasons mentioned on its discussion page. Please edit this article and remove this notice once these issues have been resolved. Notice added on 2009-01-10.
Coaxial cable is any cable that has two channels or wires shielded from each other by a dielectric (non-conductive) material. They are all encased in a protective cover. First invented in 1929, and used commercially in 1941, today coaxial cable comes in hundreds of types and is used in thousands of applications. Originally created with copper, today coaxial cable may use a variety of internal metals. Most of us are familiar with how the coaxial cable is used to wire cable and televisions systems. In this wiki, we'll look at how to attach your own connectors to cable TV coaxial cable.

video:video.video:title: How to Calm a Cat
video:video.video:description: Relaxed Kitty Is your cat stressing out or having a "spaz attack" because (s)he heard something, company's over, or there's a lighting and thunderstorm? If your kitty is scared, anxious, or overwhelmed, read this page.

video:video.video:title: How to Drift a Car
video:video.video:description: A drifting car will slide around a turn at an angle.Drifting is a driving technique and a motor sport where a car slides at an angle, with its side moving in the direction of the turn.

video:video.video:title: How to Jump Double Dutch
video:video.video:description: Double Dutch is playing jump rope with two ropes and two people jumping simultaneously. This involves four people total, two jumping and two turning the ropes. While the jumping-rope is going on, the two persons turning the ropes often recite rhymes in rhythm. An example: "Ice cream soda pop cherries on top,how many boyfriends have you got?Is it A, B, C, D,..." Double Dutch started as a street game, but now has advanced to competitions with awards and prizes, and is being considered as a serious sport for the Olympics.

video:video.video:title: How to Drive Manual
video:video.video:description: Intimidating, isn't it?Have you ever wanted to learn at least the basics of how to drive a manual transmission? Luckily, the basic concepts of starting to move a manual transmission car and shifting through the gears is a process anyone can learn. This guide will help you out so that day you get in a manual car, you won't look too bad.

video:video.video:title: How to Drift a Car
video:video.video:description: A drifting car will slide around a turn at an angle.Drifting is a driving technique and a motor sport where a car slides at an angle, with its side moving in the direction of the turn.

video:video.video:title: How to Make Jacob's Ladder out of String
video:video.video:description: If you never learned to make a Jacob's Ladder string figure as a kid, it's not too late! Unlike cat's cradle, which requires two people, this string figure can be made by a single individual. It's a good way to become familiar with a pastime that's been enjoyed by many societies, past and present, throughout the world.[1]

video:video.video:title: How to Do a Handstand
video:video.video:description: Doing a handstand is not only fun, but it's also a good form of exercise and can be used to impress people. Here's how to get a steady, graceful handstand going.
